王.definition: (literary) (of a monarch) to reign over (a kingdom)

王不留行.definition: cowherb (Vaccaria segetalis); cowherb seeds (used in TCM)

王世充.definition: Wang Shichong (-621), general of late Sui and opponent of early Tang

王丹.definition: Wang Dan (1969-), Chinese dissident, one of the leaders of the Beijing student democracy movement of 1989

王五.definition: Wang Wu, name for an unspecified person, third of a series of three: 張三|张三[Zhang1 San1], 李四[Li3 Si4], 王五 Tom, Dick and Harry

王仙芝.definition: Wang Xianzhi, peasant leader during Huang Chao peasant uprising 黃巢起義|黄巢起义 875-884 in late Tang

王伾.definition: Wang Pi (-c. 806), Tang dynasty chancellor and a leader of failed Yongzhen reform 永貞革新|永贞革新 of 805

王充.definition: Wang Chong (27-97), rationalist and critical philosopher

王八.definition: softshell turtle; cuckold; (old) male owner of a brothel

王八犢子.definition: see 王八羔子[wang2 ba1 gao1 zi5]

王力.definition: Wang Li (1900-1986), one of the pioneers of modern Chinese linguistics

王力雄.definition: Wang Lixiong (1953-), Chinese writer, author of Yellow Peril 黃禍|黄祸[Huang2 huo4]

王勃.definition: Wang Bo (650-676), one of the Four Great Poets of the Early Tang 初唐四傑|初唐四杰[Chu1 Tang2 Si4 jie2]

王勵勤.definition: Wang Liqin (1978-), former PRC table tennis player, Olympic medalist

王叔文.definition: Wang Shuwen (735-806), famous Tang dynasty scholar, Go player and politician, a leader of failed Yongzhen Reform 永貞革新|永贞革新[Yong3 zhen1 Ge2 xin1] of 805

王君如.definition: Cyndi Wang (1982-), Taiwanese singer and actress

王國聚會所.definition: Kingdom Hall (place of worship used by Jehovah's Witnesses)

王太后.definition: Queen Dowager (in Europe); widowed queen; Queen mother

王夫之.definition: Wang Fuzhi (1619-1692), wide-ranging scholar of the Ming-Qing transition

王婆賣瓜，自賣自誇.pinyin: wang2 po2 mai4 gua1 , zi4 mai4 zi4 kua1
王婆賣瓜，自賣自誇.definition: every potter praises his own pot (idiom); all one's geese are swans

王安石.definition: Wang Anshi (1021-1086), Song dynasty politician and writer, one of the Eight Giants 唐宋八大家

王家衛.definition: Wong Kar-wai (1956-), Hong Kong film director

王實甫.definition: Wang Shifu (fl. 1295-1307), author of Romance of the West Chamber 西廂記|西厢记

王導.definition: Wang Dao (276-339), powerful official of Jin dynasty and brother of general Wang Dun 王敦, regent of Jin from 325

王岱輿.definition: Wang Daiyu (1584-1670), Hui Islamic scholar of the Ming-Qing transition

王希孟.definition: Wang Ximeng (c. 1096-c. 1119), Song artist, probably teenage prodigy who died young, painter of Thousand Miles of Landscape 千里江山

王府井.definition: Wangfujing, a shopping district in Beijing, known for its pedestrian street, luxury brands, traditional stores and vibrant food markets

王心凌.definition: stage name of Cyndi Wang; see 王君如[Wang2 Jun1 ru2]

王敦.definition: Wang Dun (266-324), powerful general of Jin dynasty and brother of civil official Wang Dao 王導|王导, subsequently rebellious warlord 322-324

王明.definition: Wang Ming (1904-1974), Soviet-trained Chinese communist, Comintern and Soviet stooge and left adventurist in the 1930s, fell out with Mao and moved to Soviet Union from 1956

王昭君.definition: Wang Zhaojun (52-19 BC), famous beauty at the court of Han emperor Yuan 漢元帝|汉元帝[Han4 Yuan2 di4], one of the four legendary beauties 四大美女[si4 da4 mei3 nu:3]

王朔.definition: Wang Shuo (1958-), Chinese writer, director and actor

王楊盧駱.definition: abbr. for Wang Bo 王勃[Wang2 Bo2], Yang Jiong 楊炯|杨炯[Yang2 Jiong3], Lu Zhaolin 盧照鄰|卢照邻[Lu2 Zhao4 lin2], and Luo Binwang 駱賓王|骆宾王[Luo4 Bin1 wang2], the Four Great Poets of the Early Tang

王楠.definition: Wang Nan (1978-), female PRC table tennis player, Olympic medalist

王欽若.definition: Wang Qinruo (962-1025), Northern Song dynasty official

王毅.definition: Wang Yi (1953-), PRC foreign minister (2013-) and state councilor (2018-)

王母娘娘.definition: another name for Xi Wangmu 西王母, Queen Mother of the West

王永民.definition: Wang Yongmin (1943-), inventor of the five stroke input method 五筆輸入法|五笔输入法[wu3 bi3 shu1 ru4 fa3]

王治郅.definition: Wang Zhizhi (1977-), former Chinese basketball player

王法.definition: the law; the law of the land; the law of a state (in former times); criterion

王洪文.definition: Wang Hongwen (1935-1992), one of the Gang of Four

王炸.definition: both jokers, the unbeatable play in the card game "dou dizhu" 鬥地主|斗地主[dou4 di4zhu3]

王猛.definition: Wang Meng (325-375), prime minister to Fu Jian 苻堅|苻坚[Fu2 Jian1] of Former Qin 前秦[Qian2 Qin2]

王益.definition: Wangyi District of Tongchuan City 銅川市|铜川市[Tong2 chuan1 Shi4], Shaanxi

王益區.definition: Wangyi District of Tongchuan City 銅川市|铜川市[Tong2 chuan1 Shi4], Shaanxi

王碼.definition: Wang code, same as 五筆字型|五笔字型[wu3 bi3 zi4 xing2], five stroke input method for Chinese characters by numbered strokes, invented by Wang Yongmin 王永民[Wang2 Yong3 min2] in 1983

王禹偁.definition: Wang Yucheng (954-1001) Song dynasty literary figure

王穎.definition: Wayne Wang (1949-), Chinese US film director

王粲.definition: Wang Can (177-217), poet, generally regarded as the most brilliant of "the seven masters of Jian'an" 建安[Jian4 an1]

王義夫.definition: Wang Yifu (1960-), male PRC pistol shooter and Olympic medalist

王羲之.definition: Wang Xizhi (303-361), famous calligrapher of Eastern Jin, known as the sage of calligraphy 書聖|书圣

王老五.definition: bachelor (lit. fifth child of the Wangs)

王肅.definition: Wang Su (c. 195-256), classical scholar of Cao Wei dynasty, believed to have forged several classical texts

王莽.definition: Wang Mang (45 BC-23 AD), usurped power and reigned 9-23 between the former and later Han

王菲.definition: Faye Wong (1969-), Hong Kong pop star and actress

王著.definition: Wang Zhu (-c. 990), Song calligrapher and writer

王道.definition: the Way of the King; statecraft; benevolent rule; virtuous as opposed to the Way of Hegemon 霸道

王選.definition: Wang Xuan (1937-2006), Chinese printing industry innovator

王陽明.definition: Wang Yangming (1472-1529), Ming dynasty Neo-Confucian philosopher, influential in the School of Mind 心學|心学[xin1 xue2]
